comments: Number of lattice paths from (0,0) to (n-4,0) that stay weakly in the first quadrant and such that each step is either U=(2,1), D=(2,-1), blue H=(1,0), or red h=(1,0) (n>=4). E.g. a(8)=17 because we have 16 horizontal paths of length 4 with all combinations of blue and red (1,0) steps and, in addition, UD. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Dec 23 2003
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: nmax = 30; aa = ConstantArray[0,nmax]; aa[[1]] = 1; aa[[2]] = 0; aa[[3]] = 0; aa[[4]] = 1; Do[aa[[n]] = Sum[aa[[k]]*aa[[n-k]],{k,1,n-1}],{n,5,nmax}]; aa (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 25 2015 *)
prog: (Haskell)a025276 n = a025276_list !! (n-1)a025276_list = 1 : 0 : 0 : 1 : f [1,0,0,1] where   f xs = x' : f (x':xs) where     x' = sum $ zipWith (*) xs a025276_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 03 2011
author: _Clark Kimberling_
